required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomised, Controlled Trial of an Individual Deprescribing Intervention for Nursing Homes Residents
clinical_study.official_title: Opportunities and Limits to Deprescribing in Nursing Homes: Randomised, Controlled Trial of an Individual Deprescribing Intervention for Nursing Homes Residents.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the effects of a pharmacist-led, deprescribing-focused medication review on the use of inappropriate medications by nursing home residents

detailed_description.textblock:
Nursing home residents are often prescribed inappropriate medication, drugs whose negative effects outweigh potential benefits or which are not useful anymore. Inappropriate medication have been linked with worse health outcomes, hospitalisations and death. Deprescribing, the structured process of withdrawing or tapering inappropriate medications, has been studied as a potential solution to this problem.
In this study, nursing home residents living in institution which are already engaged in a deprescribing process will be randomly allocated to receive a medication review or usual care. The medication review will be performed by the nursing home pharmacist an its results will be discussed with the responsible physicians and nurses to create a deprescribing plan specifically tailored to the needs of the resident.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Inappropriate Medication at Follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Number of inappropriate medications prescribed at follow-up, assessed using the French translation of STOPP v2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Potentially Inappropriate DDDs Prescribed to Participants at Follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Appropriateness assessed using the French translation of STOPP v2; DDD defined by WHO.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Chronic Drugs Prescribed to Participants
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Chronic Drugs Prescribed to Participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Chronic DDDs Prescribed to Participants
secondary_outcome.description: Number of chronic DDDs prescribed to participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of New Drugs Prescribed as a Result of the Intervention

secondary_outcome.description: The EuroQol 5-Dimensions 5-Levels (EQ-5D-5L) tool was used to assess quality of life; this tool includes a visual analog scale, ranging from 0 to 100, 100 indicating "the best health you can imagine" and 0 "the worst health you can imagine". Higher results indicate an higher quality of life. 5 questions, each with 5 possible answers. Using a valuation set, the answers to individual questions were transformed in a numeric index value for each participants, with a maximum of 1 and an infinitely low minimum. Higher values indicates higher perceived health-related quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Common Drug-related Complaints at Follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Number of common drug-related complaints at follow-up

other_outcome.description: Number of participants hospitalized at any time during the study
Average number of days spent in hospital during the study period
Average number of falls during the study period
Number of participants who fell at least once during the study period

other_outcome.measure: Number of Falls in Participants That Fell at Least Once
Number of Days Spent With Physical Restraints

arm_group.description: Participants allocated to the intervention arm will receive the Individual Deprescribing Intervention (pharmacist-led medication review, followed by the creation of a deprescribing plan by the pharmacist, physician and responsible nurse).
Participants allocated to the control group will receive usual care.

intervention.description: The pharmacist responsible for the nursing home will perform a medication review (type 3). The results of this review will be discussed with the physician and nurse responsible for this participant, with the goal of creating a personalised deprescribing plan. Once validated by the physician, this plan will be submitted to the participant for approval.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Take 5 or more prescribed drugs daily;
- Reside in the Nursing Home since at least 4 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Physician judges that discussing deprescribing with them risks destabilising them.

overall_official.affiliation: ISPSO, Universties of Geneva and Lausanne, Switzerland

link.description: Project description on the funding body website

patient_data.ipd_description: Data are available from the investigators upon reasonable request.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data are available from the investigators upon reasonable request.

group.title: Individual Deprescribing Intervention
group.description: Participants allocated to the intervention arm will receive the Individual Deprescribing Intervention (pharmacist-led medication review, followed by the creation of a deprescribing plan by the pharmacist, physician and responsible nurse). Individual Deprescribing Intervention: The pharmacist responsible for the nursing home will perform a medication review (type 3). The results of this review will be discussed with the physician and nurse responsible for this participant, with the goal of creating a personalised deprescribing plan. Once validated by the physician, this plan will be submitted to the participant for approval.

group.title: Control
group.description: Participants allocated to the control group will receive usual care.

baseline.population: Intervention: 1 participant excluded, died before initial data collection; Control: 3 participants excluded: 2 died before initial data collection, no data was collected on one.

group.title: Individual Deprescribing Intervention
group.description: Participants allocated to the intervention arm will receive the Individual Deprescribing Intervention (pharmacist-led medication review, followed by the creation of a deprescribing plan by the pharmacist, physician and responsible nurse). Individual Deprescribing Intervention: The pharmacist responsible for the nursing home will perform a medication review (type 3). The results of this review will be discussed with the physician and nurse responsible for this participant, with the goal of creating a personalised deprescribing plan. Once validated by the physician, this plan will be submitted to the participant for approval.

group.title: Control
group.description: Participants allocated to the control group will receive usual care.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Number of PIMs
measure.description: Number of Potentially Inappropriate Medications (PIMs); appropriateness is assessed using the French translation of the Screening Tool of Older People's Prescription (STOPP) v2.

measure.title: Number of chronic DDDs
measure.description: Number of chronic Defined Daily Dose (DDD); chronicity is defined as the absence of a planned cessation date in the participant's record. DDDs are assigned according the the World Health Organization's (WHO) DDD set.

measure.title: Number of PIM DDDs
measure.description: Sum of potentially inappropriate DDDs; appropriateness is assessed using the French translation of STOPP v2; DDDs are assigned according to the WHO's DDD set.

measure.title: Quality of life: EQ-5D-5L analog scale
measure.description: The EuroQol 5-Dimensions 5-Levels (EQ-5D-5L) tool was used to assess quality of life; this tool includes a visual analog scale, ranging from 0 to 100, 100 indicating "the best health you can imagine" and 0 "the worst health you can imagine". Higher results indicate an higher quality of life.

measure.title: Quality of life: EQ-5D-5L index
measure.description: The quality of life was assessed using EQ-5D-5L; this tool includes 5 questions, each with 5 possible answers. Using a valuation set, the answers to individual questions were transformed in a numeric index value for each participants, with a maximum of 1 and an infinitely low minimum. Higher values indicates higher perceived health-related quality of life.

Higher results indicate an higher quality of life. 5 questions, each with 5 possible answers. Using a valuation set, the answers to individual questions were transformed in a numeric index value for each participants, with a maximum of 1 and an infinitely low minimum. Higher values indicates higher perceived health-related quality of life.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
